1753364138.000001.text: OpsGenie: *P1: Goldkern Husks: hopper@gh.com Dashboards not loading!!!*

1753364738.000002.text:
*@suppurt-ui* All GH dashboards are down. 
Searched Confluence, StackExchange, ServiceNow, Runbooks! 
Need someone from the UI team to take a look!

1753364858.000003.text:
Is it just one client?
How many users impacted??
 Any screenshots??? ... 
Did you screenshare with the user??? *cc:@rosie,@atta*

1753537506.000004.text:
Did you ask them to clear their browser cache?
Are they _even_ using a supported browser?
It could be _their_ firewalls are blocking websockets!

1753538106.000004.text:
Ok - checked with the client. 
All good on their end!
 Hopper is escalating this, as 15 mins SLA was breached!

1753538161.000004.text:
Argh! I've been looking through the screenshots and logs,
its just third party libraries errors I've been asking the team to clean up for weeks!

1753538401.000004.text:
*@all* *Hopper has escalated to Ant Intelligence execs*.
 We need coordinated updates - WHY is our status page still showing healthy?
 Can the SRE team check? @manny

1753538461.000005.text: Lets calm down here a bit - health checks as all pods are healthy, no crashes anywhere!

1753538521.000004.text: I'm sure the C++ team released over the weekend without telling us! *@Dot,@atta* Why is no one from C++ team here?

1753538530.000002.text: Everyone is at CPPCon this week!

1753539310.000005.text:
There were no releases. I just checked Argo. But something interesting...
 the processor pod logs have a json field - `rows_read: 0` on every msg!

1753539370.000001.text: OpsGenie: *P1: Goldkern Husks: hopper@gh.com Any Progress yet? What's the ETA for fix???*

1753539375.000004.text: *@all* This is all hands of deck. @Flik what's @manny saying? Can you check the onprem airflow cluster?

1753539610.000005.text:
Looks like the nightly ticker load job has *NOT* completed ... its stuck for 15 hours, generally gets done in 5 hours
 trying to find what's going on

1753541710.000005.text: I think I found the smoking gun! The disk where the job is writing is full, so its crashing but it keeps failing silently and retrying ...

1753541770.000005.text: We received no disk pressure alerts!

1753541890.000005.text:
This disk was kept clean by a cron job on the host itself and there is no disk pressure monitors.
 I've cleaned up manually and rerun with more workers, now it should be done within a couple of hours!
